results.title: William Shakespeare, background for his works
results.brief_description: Shows the places of Shakespeare’s times and the elements of his English life that gave the poet-playwright his language and shaped his character. Kenilworth Castle, Stratford, the River Avon, the Anne Hathaway cottage and a model of the original Globe Theatre are portrayed. Brief episodes are presented from some of the plays of Shakespeare: “Romeo and Juliet”, “Macbeth”, “Taming of the Shrew”, “The Merchant of Venice”, and “Hamlet”.

results.title: William Shakespeare [man of the millennium]
results.brief_description: Featuring interviews with Jonathan Miller, Glenda Jackson, Baz Luhrmann, Germaine Greer, Kenneth Branagh, Julie Taymor, Jonathan Bate, Mark Rylance, Harold Bloom and Anthony Holden, Shakespeare afficionados attempt to explain the universal appeal of the playwright and poet, William Shakespeare. The common motif that appears in the interviews is his ability to capture the human condition and the subsequent resonance with society, both at the time of writing, and today. Interspersing classical and more recent interpretations of Shakespeare, as well as oration from plays and sonnets, the documentary confirms the idea that Shakespeare is still relevant today. The video also focuses on the myth of Shakespeare, explaining how he has been deified and turned into a tourist industry. It also discusses the role that cinema has in bringing Shakespeare to the masses and keeping the spirit of his writing, and the personality of the author, alive. Narrated by Melvyn Bragg.

results.title: William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet (Zeffirelli)
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Anthony Havelock-Allan, John Brabourne and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Italian director Franco Zeffirelli stunned the screen world when he cast two young unknowns to portray the star-crossed lovers. It was a gamble that resulted in one of the most popular motion pictures of our time winning international acclaim and four Academy Award nominations. Filmed in Tuscany and in the palace once owned by the Borgias, the magnificent sets, excellent supporting actors and attractive costumes lend a breathtaking atmosphere to this wonderful film. Starring Olivia Hussey, Leonard Whiting and Michael York with Laurence Olivier narrating. Screenplay by Franco Brusati, Masolino D’Amico and Franco Zeffirelli. Music by Nino Rota.

results.title: William Shakespeare's Hamlet [Widescreen] [Branagh]
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, David Barron and Kenneth Branagh
results.brief_description: A massive all star cast brings to life this full text version of William Shakespeare’s Hamlet. With his usual brash exuberance and strong visual style Kenneth Branagh works hard to keep the pace rolling, integrating the acting styles of experienced Shakespearian theatre actors such as Judi Dench, Richard Briers and Derek Jacobi with an international movie star cast, including Gerard Depardieu, Charleton Heston, Richard Attenborough and Julie Christie. With an introductory ‘behind the scenes’ look at the making of the film, including an interview with Branagh.

results.title: William S. Burroughs: commissioner of sewers
results.brief_description: Arguably Burroughs is the greatest talent to emerge from the “Beat” generation. In his novels, poetry, films and performance he has created an oppositional and profane aesthetic which continues to inspire contemporary artists and writers who refuse to - or cannot - work within the mainstream. This video features footage of Burroughs reading his poetry, excerpts from films by Gus van Sant, Antony Balch and Klaus Maeck, as well as a long interview where the writer explains his ideas on artistic inspiration; his belief that language is constituted as a virus; his use of “cut-up” and “fold- in” to represent contemporary experience of space and time; and the value of dreams for inspiration. Abrupt, unapologetic and disturbing this documentary reveals Burroughs as possessed of a profound intelligence, and as having the genius to translate his questioning and doubt into innovative and powerful art.

results.title: William Primrose: a violist's legacy
results.creator_credit: KBYU-TV, Brigham Young University and Mark D Collier
results.brief_description: A biographical documentary on Scottish born classical musician, William Primrose, who first studied the violin but very soon changed to the viola and became one of the world’s leading viola players, renowned as a soloist and chamber musician. In this documentary video, recorded at Brigham Young University, William Primrose reminisces about his past with host Dr David Dalton, accompanied by stills, archival footage and additional biographical material from William Primrose’s autobiography, “Walk on the North Side”.

results.title: William Morris Hughes
results.brief_description: The life and political career of William Hughes, Prime Minister of Australia during 1915-1922, shown in contemporary film and stills. Includes film footage of World War I. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: William Faulkner's barn burning
results.creator_credit: Learning in Focus, Calvin Skaggs and Peter Werner
results.brief_description: Based on a William Faulkner story set in the late nineteenth century in which a young boy faces the agonizing decision of whether or not to betray his embittered father, who burns his employer’s barn in an act of revenge. Series hosted by Henry Fonda and stars Tommy Lee Jones.
